newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU jobless rate stable at 10.8 percent in August.
newsitem.headline: EU jobless rate stable at 10.8 percent in August.

text.p: Unemployment in the European Union remained stable at 10.8 percent in August for the third consecutive month, the EU's statistics office Eurostat said on Monday.
This meant a total 18 million people without jobs. The EU's jobless rate compares with 5.2 percent in the United States and 3.3 percent in Japan.

Eurostat said the European unemployment trend had been level or down in all EU states but France. The French rate, the Union's fourth highest, increased to 12.4 percent in August from 12.3 percent the previous month.
Spain continued to record the highest rate of joblessness at 21.3 percent, followed by Finland and Ireland. At the other end of the table remained Luxembourg at 3.1 percent
Following are the latest annual unemployment rates for the 15 member countries in August.
